segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, forming a little waterfall onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s kind of disconcerting to see the woman so unfazed by it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she feel the coolness of the water soaking her shoe?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The little boy on the stool makes me hold my breath, hoping he won’t fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks so determined, reaching for those cookies, it's almost adorable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the risk he’s taking gnaws at me, unsettling my peace.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s outstretched hand is just as sweet as her eagerness for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t remember if I ever acted that carefree when I was their age.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think back to my childhood, the way we used to sneak cookies too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I also wonder, do they realize what might happen when they get caught?
segments.speaker: PAR
